alert.note: Alert for Jack; Young (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 9:17PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Young and Jack Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 916 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Graham, or 7 miles north of Graham, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Graham, Jacksboro, Bryson, Lake Graham, Fort Richardson State Park, Newport, Perrin, Cundiff, Jermyn, Lost Creek Reservoir, Jean, Loving, Bartons Chapel, Antelope, Postoak and South Bend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for north central Texas.
